newsitem.title: USA: Vermont September jobless rate firms to 4.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Vermont September jobless rate firms to 4.4 pct.

text.p: Vermont on Tuesday said that in September its unemployment rate rose 0.1 percentage point to 4.4 percent from August when seasonally adjusted, despite a boost in hirings in construction and education.

"Unemployment increased slightly in September, but we also experienced a temporary surge in jobs, partly due to stonger than usual activity in construction and higher education," said Susan Auld, the commissioner of the state Department of Employment and Training.
While Vermont's latest rate also was 0.1 percentage point higher than a year-ago, it is below the overall U.S. rate of 5.2 percent.
The unemployment rates in the state's 13 labor markets ranged from 1.8 percent in Hartford-Lebanon to 7.8 percent in Newport, when not seasonally adjusted.
